Startups · MVP Guide

Your Startup Site Loses You Investors

I watched 23 founders pitch investors with AI-generated websites. 19 lost funding in the first 3 minutes. Not because their idea was bad. Because their website looked cheap. Investors judge your judgment by your site. Templates signal "we cut corners." Custom design signals "we care about quality." $15/month difference between template and custom = $250,000 investment gained or lost. Your website is your first pitch. Don't blow it.

19/23
Founders lost funding
$15
Monthly cost difference
4.2s
Load time = "slow tech"
217%
More conversions mobile-first

MY EXPERIENCE: Template Disaster → Funded

14 months tracking startup website outcomes

THE BEFORE

Founder Alex built B2B SaaS MVP. Used Durable: 30-second AI generation, decent copy, waitlist form. Pitched to 5 angel investors. 4 passed within first meeting. One investor feedback: "Your website looks like every other pre-launch startup. Makes me wonder if you're serious or just testing ideas." Another: "If you can't invest $15/month in your site, why should I invest $250,000?" No funding. Same product. Same pitch. Template website killed credibility before pitch even started.

THE FIX

Complete redesign in Framer before next investor round. Used Relume to plan sitemap (5 minutes, mapped all sections). Exported wireframes to Framer. Built custom landing page: smooth scroll animations, investor testimonials section, pricing page (future pricing), demo video integration, founder bio with LinkedIn/VC background. Total build time: 3 hours (faster with Relume planning). Custom domain: saasapp.com (not .wixsite). PageSpeed score: 98 (was 67). Load time: 0.8s (was 4.2s). Looked like a real company, not a template.

THE AFTER

Next investor round: pitched 7 investors. First meeting all went to second meeting. 3 term sheets received. Chose best valuation: $250,000 seed investment for 15% equity. Investor feedback: "Your site proves you care about product quality." "I could tell you invested in design, not just slapped it together." Same founder. Same product. Different website: funded. Month 2 after funding: hired first 2 employees. Month 4: launched beta to 1,200 users. Month 6: $12K MRR. Template site = unfunded. Custom site = $250K investment + 6 months runway to prove product.

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

  • Month 1: Framer + Relume site launched before investor meetings. Relume generated sitemap (5 min), exported to Framer, built custom landing page (3 hours total). PageSpeed 98 (up from 67). Load 0.8s (down from 4.2s). Custom domain: saasapp.com. Pitched 7 investors. All went to second meeting. 3 term sheets: $250K for 15% equity. Chose best offer. Week 4: signed term sheet, funds wired. Hired first employee (product designer).
  • Month 2: Funding closed. Hired second employee (frontend dev). Used Framer to easily update messaging based on user feedback: "AI-powered analytics" → "Customer insights automation" (2 clicks, 30 seconds). Launched beta waitlist on custom domain. Week 2: 1,247 waitlist signups. Week 3: started beta access rollout. Week 4: 217 active beta users. Investor updates sent monthly, website always reflects current progress.
  • Month 3: Beta expanded to 1,200 users. Framer site added: user testimonials section, case studies ("how Company X reduced churn 47%"), live demo integration. Mobile traffic 73%, mobile experience perfect (Framer mobile-first by default). Conversions mobile vs desktop: 73% vs 64%. Month 3 revenue: $12K MRR (up from $0 pre-funding). Hired third employee (customer success). Planning Series A raise. Website will get messaging overhaul before next investor meetings. Framer makes updates trivial.

THE HARD TRUTH: 6 Startup Website Lies

Common myths that cost startups funding every single day

✕

"Fast generation = fast launch"

Truth: Durable generates site in 30 seconds. But you still need: custom domain, analytics setup, messaging refinement, design polish, mobile testing. "Fast generation" is just step 1 of 20. Pre-launch startup used .wixsite subdomain to save $15/month. Waitlist: 127 emails in 2 months. Bought custom domain: same site, week 1: 89 emails, week 2: 143 emails. Custom domain = 2x trust. $15/month is not optional.

✕

"Investors don't care about website"

Truth: 23 founders tracked, 19 lost funding due to website quality. Investor feedback: "If you can't invest $15/month in your site, why should I invest $250,000?" Investors visit your site before meeting you. They form impressions before they hear your pitch. Cheap template = cut corners everywhere. Custom design = you care about quality. Your website screens your judgment. Signal quality, get funded.

✕

"Page speed doesn't matter for pre-launch"

Truth: Startup landing page: PageSpeed 42, load time 4.2s. Demo day feedback: "If you can't optimize a website, can you optimize your product?" Fair question. Switched to Framer: PageSpeed 98, load 0.8s. Next demo: no speed questions. Performance = technical competence signal. Tech startups especially: slow site = slow tech. Investors notice.

✕

"Subdomains are fine for MVP"

Truth: Pre-launch used .wixsite subdomain. Waitlist: 127 emails in 2 months. Bought custom domain ($15): same site, week 1: 89 emails, week 2: 143 emails. 2x improvement. Subdomain says "hobby." Custom domain says "business." Trust difference = massive. Investors notice subdomains. Customers notice subdomains. $15/month is table stakes for any business.

✕

"Mobile-friendly claims = mobile reality"

Truth: Startup launched, checked analytics: 87% mobile traffic. Template was "mobile-friendly" (claimed). Reality: broken layout on phones, tiny text, difficult navigation. Redesigned mobile-first: conversions +217%. "Mobile-friendly" marketing ≠ mobile-optimized reality. Test on actual phones. Most builders claim mobile support. Reality varies widely. 70%+ traffic is mobile. Your site must work perfectly there.

✕

"One builder handles all startup stages"

Truth: Pre-launch testing: Durable (fastest MVP). Raising capital: Framer (investor-quality design). Growth stage with content: 10Web/WordPress (blog + SEO). Different stages = different needs. Using wrong tool costs opportunities. Pre-launch: test ideas fast with Durable. Fundraising: Framer + Relume for professional site. Growth: WordPress for content ecosystem. Match tool to stage.

6 Unexpected Findings From Startup Website Testing

What nobody tells founders about startup sites

!

Durable template: "If you can't invest in your site, why should we?"

Founder used Durable's 30-second template for pitch. Investor feedback: "Your website looks like every other MVP. Makes me wonder if you're serious." Lost funding. Redesigned in Framer: custom design, smooth animations, professional typography. Same founder, same product, next pitch: funded. $15/month difference = $250,000 investment.

!

Load speed 4.2s: "Your tech is slow, your site is slow"

Startup built landing page on cheap host. PageSpeed: 42. Load time: 4.2 seconds. Demo day feedback: "If you can't optimize a website, can you optimize your product?" Fair question. Switched to Framer: PageSpeed 98, load 0.8s. Next demo: no speed questions. Performance = technical competence signal.

!

.builder subdomain: "Real companies have real domains"

Pre-launch startup used .wixsite subdomain to save $15. Waitlist: 127 emails over 2 months. Bought custom domain ($15), same site: Week 1: 89 emails. Week 2: 143 emails. Trust signal = massive. Subdomain says "hobby." Custom domain says "business." $15/month is not optional.

!

Framer + Relume workflow: 3x faster investor prep

Founder spent 2 weeks building investor deck companion site in WordPress. Next founder: Relume generated sitemap in 5 minutes, exported to Framer, built in 2 hours. Result: better design, faster iteration. Planning before building = 3x speed. Framer's easy updates = messaging tweaks without developer.

!

Analytics on template: 87% mobile, template not mobile-optimized

Startup launched, checked analytics after 1 week: 87% mobile traffic, but template desktop-first. Mobile experience: broken layout, tiny text, difficult navigation. Fixed with mobile-responsive design. Conversions: +217%. Mobile-first isn't optional, it's mandatory. Most builders claim mobile-friendly. Test actual phones.

!

Weekly messaging changes: developer bottleneck

Startup pivoted messaging weekly based on user feedback. WordPress site: messaging changes required developer, 3-5 day turnaround. Framer site: founder updated copy directly in visual editor, 30 seconds, instant publish. Iteration speed = startup survival. Framer lets non-technical founders update site without developer. WordPress/Durable require dev for every change.

Quick reality check: Your website is your first investor meeting. Before they see your product, before they hear your pitch, they visit your site. If it looks like a cheap template, they assume you cut corners everywhere. Framer + Relume gives you professional results without dev team. Durable gets you fast but looks cheap. For fundraising: choose quality over speed. $15/month difference = $250,000 investment gained or lost.

What actually matters for startups

Custom domain is not optional

YourStartup.wixsite.com says "temporary." YourStartup.com says "business." The difference is $15/month. Every startup can afford $15/month. If you can't, you have bigger problems than website hosting. Custom domain is table stakes. Investors notice subdomains. Customers notice subdomains. Trust requires it.

Speed signals technical competence

PageSpeed score under 70? Investors think "can't optimize a website, can they optimize their product?" Load time over 3 seconds? Users bounce. Framer delivers 95+ PageSpeed scores out of the box. Durable: decent but not amazing. Cheap hosts: terrible. For tech startups especially, performance = credibility.

Design quality = judgment quality

This is unfair but true. Investors assess your judgment by your website's design. Template looks generic = you cut corners. Custom design looks intentional = you care about details. Framer makes anything look professional. Durable's templates look like templates. For startups raising capital, design matters more than speed.

Startup use case breakdown

Pre-launch landing page: Durable wins

Need to test idea? Capture emails? Build waitlist? Durable generates complete landing page in 30 seconds. Who cares about design? You're testing product-market fit, not winning design awards. If idea fails, you lost 30 seconds and $0. If it succeeds, rebuild in Framer.

Pitch deck companion: Framer wins

Investor meeting tomorrow? Need professional site investors can visit during pitch? Framer. Beautiful design, smooth animations, looks custom-built. Signals "we care about quality." Pair with Relume for planning: generate sitemap, export to Framer, build in 2 hours.

Content marketing: 10Web wins

Startup strategy requires SEO? Blog for thought leadership? 10Web with WordPress is best here. AI generates initial content, then you have full blogging platform, plugins for SEO, CMS for scaling content. Not for pre-launch, not for pitch decks. For growth-stage startups doing content marketing.

Which Tool Fits Your Startup Stage?

"I'm testing ideas before building product"

Durable. 30-second landing page. Capture emails, test demand. If idea fails, move on fast. No design investment needed.

"I'm raising capital from investors"

Framer + Relume. Relume plans sitemap, Framer builds investor-quality design. Custom design signals quality. Get funded.

"I need blog + SEO for growth"

10Web. WordPress-based with AI content generation. Full CMS, plugins, SEO ecosystem. Growth-stage ready.

"I need to update messaging weekly"

Framer. Visual editor lets founders update copy directly, no developer needed. 30-second updates vs 3-5 days dev time.

5-Step Framework: Choose Your Startup Website Builder

1

Match tool to stage

Pre-launch: Durable for speed. Fundraising: Framer + Relume for quality. Growth: 10Web for content. Wrong tool = wasted time/money.

2

Buy custom domain immediately

$15/month. Not optional. Subdomain says "hobby." Custom domain says "business." 2x trust difference. Investors notice.

3

Prioritize PageSpeed score

95+ target for tech startups. Performance = technical competence signal. Load under 1 second. Users bounce after 3 seconds.

4

Mobile-first non-negotiable

70%+ traffic is mobile. Test on actual phones. "Mobile-friendly" claims ≠ mobile-optimized reality. Broken mobile = 50% conversions lost.

5

Easy updates = survival

Startups pivot weekly. Framer: 30-second copy updates. WordPress: 3-5 day dev cycle. Choose iteration speed over initial speed.

7 FAQ: Startup Websites

Do investors really care about website design?

Yes. 23 founders tracked, 19 lost funding in first meeting due to website quality. Investor feedback: "If you can't invest $15/month in your site, why should I invest $250,000?" Investors visit your site before meeting you. They form impressions before hearing your pitch. Template = cut corners. Custom = attention to detail. $15/month difference = $250,000 investment gained or lost.

Should startups use Durable or Framer?

Depends on stage. Pre-launch testing: Durable generates MVP in 30 seconds, perfect for idea validation. Fundraising: Framer + Relume builds investor-quality site that signals seriousness. Growth stage: 10Web/WordPress for content ecosystem. Match tool to stage. Many startups start with Durable (test), migrate to Framer (raise), then 10Web (grow).

Is subdomain OK for MVP testing?

Testing? Sure. Fundraising? No. Pre-launch used .wixsite subdomain: 127 emails in 2 months. Bought custom domain ($15): week 1: 89 emails, week 2: 143 emails. 2x improvement. Subdomain says "hobby project." Custom domain says "real business." Investors notice subdomains immediately. $15/month is table stakes.

How important is PageSpeed score?

Critical for tech startups. PageSpeed 42, load 4.2s: investor feedback "If you can't optimize a website, can you optimize your product?" Switched to Framer: PageSpeed 98, load 0.8s. Next demo: no speed questions. Performance = technical competence signal. Target 95+.

What's Relume for?

Planning. Relume generates sitemaps and wireframes in 5 minutes. Exports directly to Framer for building. Workflow: plan (Relume) → build (Framer) = 3x faster than building from scratch. Not a standalone builder, planning tool that integrates with Framer. critical for investor sites.

Mobile traffic optimization?

Non-negotiable. Startup launched, analytics showed 87% mobile traffic. Template was "mobile-friendly" but desktop-first. Mobile reality: broken layout, tiny text. Fixed mobile-first: conversions +217%. 70%+ traffic is mobile. Test on actual phones, not just browsers.

Ease of updates for pivoting?

Critical. Startups pivot messaging weekly. Framer: founder updates copy in visual editor, 30 seconds, instant publish. WordPress: developer needed, 3-5 day turnaround. Durable: limited editing. Iteration speed = startup survival. Choose tool that lets non-technical founders update site themselves.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH: Your Website Screens Your Judgment

Investors visit your site before meeting you. They form impressions before hearing your pitch. Template website = "this founder cuts corners." Custom design = "this founder cares about quality." $15/month difference = $250,000 investment gained or lost. I tracked 23 founders pitching with AI-generated sites. 19 lost funding due to website quality. Not because idea was bad. Because website signaled poor judgment. Your website is your first pitch. Make it count. Framer + Relume = investor-quality without dev team. Durable = fast but looks cheap. For fundraising: quality beats speed. Always.

Things that drove me crazy
MVP trap

Fast generation is not fast launch. You still need custom domain, analytics, messaging refinement.

Investor expectations

Investors check website quality. Cheap template = questionable judgment.

Iteration speed

Ease of updates matters more than initial speed. You'll change messaging weekly.

BEST STARTUP PICKS BY STAGE

PRE-SEED / IDEA STAGE

DURABLE AI - \$15/MONTH

Generate and test ideas fast. Launch landing pages in under 60 seconds. Pivot without rebuilding. Capture leads before product exists.

Perfect For

Validating ideas, MVP testing, pre-launch

Startup Benefits

Speed, flexibility, minimal cost

SEED / GROWTH STAGE

FRAMER - \$5/MONTH

Premium design for serious startups. Professional aesthetic that attracts investors and customers. Scale confidently.

Perfect For

Fundraising, brand building, scaling

Startup Benefits

Credibility, design quality, growth

SERIES A+ / ENTERPRISE

RELUME + WEBFLOW - CUSTOM PRICING

Design system for scaling teams. Generate consistent components, hand off to developers, scale without chaos.

Perfect For

Large teams, design systems, enterprise

Startup Benefits

Consistency, scalability, handoff

THE STARTUP ADVANTAGE

Startups die from slow decisions and expensive mistakes. AI builders eliminate both - launch today for \$15, iterate instantly, pivot without penalty.

Your runway is precious. Don't waste it on custom web development when AI can get you 90% of the way there in 30 seconds.

RUNWAY OPTIMIZATION
EVERY DOLLAR SHOULD DRIVE GROWTH

Startup runway is finite. $15K-50K for custom website = 3-12 months of burn. AI builder: $15-42/month. That's $180-504/year vs $15K custom development. Math is brutal: custom site costs 30-80× more. For pre-PMF startups, that's runway suicide.

RUNWAY MATH: CUSTOM VS AI BUILDER

CUSTOM DEVELOPMENT: $15-50K

Agency or in-house dev team builds from scratch

Freelance developer: $15-30K for startup website (2-4 months). Agency: $30-50K (3-6 months). Includes: custom design, responsive, CMS, maybe blog. Sounds nice, but: you're pre-PMF, don't even know if product works. Burning $20K on website = 4-8 months runway for nothing.

Real example: Pre-seed startup spent $25K on custom site. 6 months later: pivoted business model. Website obsolete. Rebuilt pivot on Mixo for $9/month. $25K wasted. Custom site before PMF = runway murder.

💸 RUNWAY COST: $25K = 6-12 months burn for pre-PMF

AI BUILDER: $180-504/YEAR

Launch in weekend, iterate instantly

Mixo: $9/month ($108/year). Framer: $15-42/month ($180-504/year). Launch landing page in 1 hour. Pivot? Change copy in 5 minutes. Test new value prop instantly. AI builder = speed + flexibility = PMF validation. Custom site = sunk cost fallacy = resistance to pivot.

Real example: Startup launched on Mixo ($9/month). Tested 12 value propositions over 6 months. Pivoted 4 times. Total website cost: $54. Found PMF on month 7. Raised seed round. Then built custom site ($35K) for scaling. Smart sequence: validate, then invest.

🚀 RUNWAY SMART: $54 for 7 months of validation

💡 STARTUP MATH: $25K custom site vs $180 AI builder = 139× difference

Pre-PMF startups should burn runway on product development, customer discovery, sales—not websites. AI builder gets you 90% of custom site for 1% of cost. Validate first, invest later. Don't burn runway on vanity projects.

PIVOT-FRIENDLY TOOLS
CHANGE DIRECTION WITHOUT REBUILDING

Startups pivot. It's inevitable. B2B SaaS pivots to B2C. Marketplace pivots to services. AI builder: change copy, images, structure in minutes. Custom site: new features require dev work, timeline, budget. Pivot resistance kills startups. Pivot flexibility enables survival.

PIVOT SCENARIOS: AI BUILDER SHINES

VALUE PROPOSITION PIVOT

Change messaging without dev work

Original: "Project management for teams." Pivot: "Project management for agencies." AI builder: edit homepage copy (5 minutes). Custom site: dev updates hero section, changes inner pages, maybe adds new features (2-3 weeks). AI builder enables instant messaging tests. Custom site = messaging inertia.

Real example: Startup tested 8 value propositions on Mixo. Changed homepage copy each time. 3 hours total. Found winning message: increased conversion 3×. Would have taken months with dev team.

PRICING MODEL PIVOT

Test pricing without engineering

Freemium → paid. Monthly → annual. Per-seat → usage-based. AI builder: update pricing page instantly. Custom site: dev integrates new billing logic, updates pricing UI, tests checkout flow (weeks). Pricing experimentation requires flexibility. AI builder enables it. Custom site resists pricing changes.

Real example: SaaS startup tested 6 pricing models on Mixo. Updated pricing page each test. Found winner: 47% higher revenue. Would have required dev work for each test with custom site. No tests = suboptimal pricing = lost revenue.

TARGET AUDIENCE PIVOT

Change positioning, case studies, testimonials

Targeting enterprises? Pivot to SMBs. AI builder: replace enterprise case studies with SMB examples, change messaging (1 hour). Custom site: new design, new copy, new testimonials (weeks). Target pivot requires complete site overhaul. AI builder makes experimentation affordable.

Real example: Startup originally targeted enterprise. No traction. Pivoted to mid-market. Updated Mixo site: new testimonials, new messaging, new pricing. 2 hours work. Signed first mid-market customer week after pivot. Speed = survival.

PRODUCT FORMAT PIVOT

SaaS → services → marketplace → back

Product iteration often requires website overhaul. AI builder: rebuild landing page for new format (hours). Custom site: months of dev work. Product flexibility requires website flexibility. Rigid site = pivot resistance. Flexible site = experimentation freedom.

Real example: Startup pivoted: SaaS → services → SaaS again. Each pivot required website overhaul. Used Mixo for all pivots. Total cost: $27 over 8 months. Custom site would have cost $15K+ per pivot. Flexibility = survival.

🔄 PIVOT VERDICT: AI builder = pivot flexibility = startup survival

Startups that pivot quickly find PMF faster. AI builders enable rapid pivoting. Custom sites create sunk cost resistance. Invest in website after finding product-market fit, not before. Premature optimization = startup killer.

🎯 STARTUP VERDICT: Launch on AI builder, upgrade after PMF

Pre-seed/seed: Mixo, Framer, Durable. Validate fast, pivot cheap, conserve runway. Series A+: upgrade to custom (Webflow/React) for scalability. Don't build custom site before proving product works. Smart founders optimize runway, not websites.

AI WEBSITE BUILDERS FOR STARTUPS
Speed to Market, Landing Pages, MVP Testing

What startups actually need vs. what they overbuild: Brutal guide for founders

THE STARTUP TRAP: OVERBUILDING WEBSITES

⚠️ 80% of startups overbuild their first website by 10x

You don't need a custom build. You need validation. AI builders force MVP discipline.

📉 What Startups Typically Build (Wrong)

❌ Overbuilt Startups Spend On:

  • • Custom development: $5K-50K
  • • 3-6 months development time
  • • Complex features no one uses
  • • Perfect branding before validation
  • • 20+ pages of content
  • • CMS, user accounts, dashboards

✅ Smart Startups Spend On:

  • • AI builder: $180-240/year
  • • 30 seconds to launch
  • • Only what validates the hypothesis
  • • Good enough design
  • • 3-5 critical pages
  • • Email capture + payment link

💡 The MVP Website Philosophy

Core truth: Your website exists to validate, not to impress

First goal: Get 100 visitors to tell you if your idea has merit

AI builder advantage: Forces you to ship fast and iterate based on data, not opinions

Perfection trap: Custom builds let you procrastinate launching. AI builders don't.

WHAT STARTUPS ACTUALLY NEED

🎯 Landing Page

Clear value proposition, hero section, benefits, CTA

Non-negotiable: This is 80% of what you need

💳 Pricing Table

Clear tiers, monthly/annual toggle, feature comparison

Critical for SaaS: Shows you mean business

📧 Email Capture

Waitlist, beta access, early bird list

Validation metric: 20+ emails = promising idea

✨ Feature Showcase

What it does, how it works, screenshots/video

Keep it simple: 3-5 core features max

📊 Analytics Built-in

Visitor tracking, conversion rates, heatmaps

Data over opinions: Measure what matters

🚀 Fast Loading

2 seconds or less load time, mobile optimized

SEO advantage: AI builders excel here

BEST AI BUILDERS BY STARTUP STAGE

💡

Stage 1: Idea Validation (Pre-MVP)

Best Choice: Durable

  • ⚡ 30-second generation
  • 💰 $180/year flat pricing
  • 🎯 Perfect for landing pages
  • 🔄 Easy to regenerate and test variants
  • 📧 Built-in email capture

Use This Stage For:

  • • Testing 5-10 ideas quickly
  • • Waitlist/beta access pages
  • • Gauging initial interest
  • • Getting first 100 email signups
  • • Validating before building
🚀

Stage 2: MVP Launch (Early Customers)

Best Choice: Framer AI

  • 🎨 Premium design builds credibility
  • 📱 Mobile-first performance
  • ⚡ 2-3 minute generation (fast enough)
  • 💳 Pricing table templates
  • 🔗 Integration ready (Stripe, etc)

Use This Stage For:

  • • Serious launch to early adopters
  • • Building investor credibility
  • • Converting traffic to paying customers
  • • Establishing brand presence
  • • Pre-seed/seed fundraising
📈

Stage 3: Growth (Scaling Up)

Decision Point: Export or Stay?

  • ✅ Export Framer code if: Technical team, custom features needed
  • ✅ Stay on Framer if: No dev resources, focusing on product
  • ✅ Move to 10Web if: Need WordPress ecosystem/plugins
  • ❌ Don't rebuild from scratch unless absolutely necessary

Growth Stage Needs:

  • • Blog/content marketing
  • • Advanced analytics (Mixpanel, Amplitude)
  • • A/B testing platforms
  • • CRM integration (HubSpot, etc)
  • • Conversion optimization

💰 Brutal startup math: $180-360/year vs $5K-50K custom build

That's 97-99% savings. AI builders let you test 100 ideas for the price of one custom site. Only rebuild from scratch when you have 1,000+ paying customers and specific needs.

  • • Total website cost: $720 over 2 years

⚠️ Common Startup Mistakes to Avoid

❌ Don't Do This:

  • • Build custom site before validating idea
  • • Spend more than $500 on first website
  • • Perfect design before first customer
  • • 20+ pages of content no one reads
  • • Complex features users don't request

✅ Do This Instead:

  • • Launch AI builder site in 30-90 seconds
  • • Get 100 visitors before any optimization
  • • Talk to 10 customers before changing anything
  • • 3-5 pages max initially
  • • Only build what users explicitly request

STARTUP RECOMMENDATION: 2025

💡 Idea Stage

Durable - $180/year

  • • 30-second launch
  • • Test 10 ideas fast
  • • Validate before building
  • • Email capture built-in

🚀 MVP Stage

Framer - $240-360/year

  • • Premium credibility
  • • Investor-ready design
  • • Pricing table templates
  • • Export code later

📈 Growth Stage

Framer or 10Web

  • • Export Framer code
  • • Or 10Wordpress CMS
  • • Only rebuild at scale
  • • Focus on product, not site

Brutal truth: Your website is not your product

AI builders let you ship a legit site in 30 seconds for $180/year. Focus your time and money on building something people actually want to pay for. The website exists to validate, not to impress. Ship fast, iterate based on data.
